articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, together with commanding officers of the KPA, visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun to pay tribute to President Kim Il Sung at 00:00 on July 8, the greatest memorial day of the nation. 
					 He entered the hall where the statues of the President and General Secretary Kim Jong Il are standing.
					
					 Laid before the statues were a floral basket in the name of Kim Jong Un, supreme commander of the KPA. 
					
					 Also placed before the statues was a floral basket in the name of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces.
					
					 Written on the ribbons of floral baskets were the letters "The great Comrades Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il will always be with us".
					
					 Kim Jong Un, together with KPA commanding officers, paid high tribute to the statues.
					
					 Then he entered the hall where the President lies in state. He, together with KPA commanding officers, made a bow to him in humblest reverence.
					
					 He went round the room preserving the orders of the President, a train he used and a car he used during the last period of his life.
					
					 He, together with KPA commanding officers, entered the hall where the portraits of smiling Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il are seen.
					
					 He, together with KPA commanding officers, made a bow to the portraits in profound reverence.
					
					 He was accompanied by KPA commanding officers including Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Jong Gak, Hyon Chol Hae, Choe Pu Il, Son Chol Ju, Pak Jae Gyong, Jo Kyong Chol, Kim Yong Chol and Ri Pyong Chol.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum 
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and  first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, visited the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum on July 8.
					 The museum has more than 80 rooms where lots of revolutionary relics and exhibits are displayed.
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un went round rooms devoted to the periods of the anti-Japanese armed struggle, democratic revolution, operations, services and arms of armed forces, the room for the victory in the war, the Chinese People's Volunteers, international support and encouragement, weapons of merit, captured weaponry, and the room showing a panoramic view of the battle to liberate Taejon and various other rooms.
					
					 He looked round with deep emotion relics showing the undying revolutionary feats the President performed by leading the war to victory and the intense loyalty to the party and the leader, popular heroism and noble spiritual and moral traits displayed by the army and people of the DPRK in the struggle to carry out the strategic and tactical policies set forth by the President and his orders.
					
					 Seeing the relics and mementoes, he noted it was a miracle of history that the army and people of the DPRK beat back the armed invaders of 16 nations including the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces and won a shining victory in the war under the wise leadership of the President.
					
					 Visiting the museum, one can keenly realize once again that the young DPRK could defeat the U.S. imperialists who boasted of being the "strongest" in the world and their satellite forces because it had a great idea, outstanding strategy and tactics and indomitable fighting spirit.
					
					 One can say in a word the victory in the war was the victory of ideology, strategy and tactics and spirit, he noted, and went on:
					
					Under the leadership of the party and the leader the army and people of the DPRK performed immortal feats and won a great victory in the war, becoming a heroic army and people who defeated the U.S. imperialist aggressors for the first time in the world.
					
					 He stressed the need for the generations to come to successfully carry forward the exploits performed by the preceding generations and their fighting spirit. 
					
					 He said the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum is an excellent educational centre for equipping service personnel, working people, youth and students with the President's Juche idea, anti-imperialist revolutionary idea, outstanding commanding art, military strategy and tactics and war methods.
					
					 He underscored the need to improve the management and operation of the museum as required by the new century.
					
					 It is necessary to intensify the work to discover more relics and mementoes related to the Fatherland Liberation War, he added.
					
					 He underlined the need to properly use and steadily improve the system, contents, forms and methods of display to suit the characteristics of the museum.
					
					 It is important to modernly renovate the museum as required by the Songun era as not a particular work has been done so far to improve the museum since it was newly built in 1974, he noted, and continued:
					
					 The KPA should undertake the renovation project and successfully carry it out.
					
					He expressed expectation and belief that the officials and lecturers of the museum would creditably perform their honorable mission in the future, too.

articles.title: Senior Party and State Officials Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Senior Party and State Officials Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim and other senior party and state officials, the chairperson of a friendly party and officials of party, armed forces and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions Sunday visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun to pay tribute to President Kim Il Sung on the 18th anniversary of his demise.
					 Seen standing before the statues of Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il was a floral basket in the name of Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					
					 Also placed there was a floral basket in the name of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces.
					
					 A floral basket was laid there in the joint name of the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the WPK, the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly and the Cabinet of the DPRK.
					
					 The visitors paid high tribute to the statues.
					
					 They made bows to Kim Il Sung in the humblest reverence.

articles.title: Remembrance Concert Given
articles.content:
Remembrance Concert Given
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- A remembrance concert commemorating the 18th anniversary of the demise of President Kim Il Sung was given at the People's Theatre Sunday. 
					 The concert began with the orchestral music "Song Devoted to Marshal Kim Il Sung." The performers highly lauded the immortal revolutionary exploits the President performed by bringing bright rays to this land like the sun, ushering in a new era of national independence and laying an eternal foundation for the prosperity of the country.
					
					 Their repertoire included numbers such as immortal classic masterpiece "Nostalgia," soprano "Our Happiness Blossoms out under the Leader's Care," women's quartet "You are Mother," orchestral music "Rich Harvest Has Visited the Chongsan Plain".
					
					 Presented there also were orchestral music "Footstep" and the forth movement "We Pledge" of symphony "The Leader Is Always with Us".
					
					Listening to them, the audience was deeply convinced that the history of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il's Korea will last forever under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, another great man. 
					
					 The concert impressively showed the faith and will of all the army and people to glorify the immortal revolutionary careers and feats of great persons of Mt. Paektu and wage a dynamic struggle to accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche rallied close around Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Among the audience were Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim, Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Yong Ho and other senior party, state and army officials, the chairperson of a friendly party, officials of party, armed forces and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, persons of merit, Pyongyang citizens, the chief of the mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front here and overseas compatriots. 
					
					 Present there on invitation were diplomatic envoys of various countries and members of military attaches corps here and other foreign guests.

articles.title: Floral Baskets Laid before Statues of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Floral Baskets Laid before Statues of Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Service personnel and people visited statues of President Kim Il Sung in different parts of the country on the 18th anniversary of the demise of the President.
					 Mansu Hill where statues of Kim Il Sung and the late General Secretary Kim Jong Il stand are crowded with people, including service personnel and schoolchildren. 
					
					 Seen standing before the statues was a floral basket sent by Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Placed before the statues were floral baskets in the name of the party, armed forces and power bodies, social organizations, ministries and national institutions, units of the KPA and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces and institutions at all levels, industrial establishments, farms and schools in Pyongyang, as well as bouquets and flowers.
					
					 The visitors made bows to the statues of the peerlessly great men.
					
					 A floral basket in the name of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front was also laid before the statues.
					
					 People from all walks of life laid floral baskets, bouquets and flowers before equestrian statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il at the Mansudae Art Studio.
					
					 People in various parts of the country visited the statues of the President in their residential areas to pay tribute to him.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Message from Cambodian King
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Message from Cambodian King
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un on July 3 received a message from Cambodian King Norodom Sihamoni on the occasion of the 18th anniversary of the demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The message said:
					
					 On the occasion of the 18th anniversary of the demise of HE President Kim Il Sung, the greatest and prominent leader of the Korean people, allow me to express the greatest admiration and high tribute to the most outstanding and prominent statesman and hero who is always remembered not only by my dear parents and the  Cambodian people but by all other people for having led the most heroic Korean people to liberation with his noble patriotism and heroism unprecedented in history and turned the DPRK into a steadily developing country.
					
					 It is my firm belief that that you will steadily carry forward the cause of peace, stability and development on the Korean Peninsula as President Kim Il Sung and Generalissimo Kim Jong Il did.
					
					 I assure you of my strong attachment to the friendly and deep relations that closely link our two countries.
					
					 I renew the assurances of highest consideration.

articles.title: Second World Media Summit Held
articles.content:
Second World Media Summit Held
 Moscow, July 7 (KCNA) --The Second World Media Summit was held in Moscow. 
					 It discussed such issues as challenges facing media in the changing world in the new century, ways to meet them, and the need to overcome speculated and biased reports, in particular, step up the technological updating of media and ensure the safety of reporters. 
					
					   Kim Pyong Ho, director general of the Korean Central News Agency, made a speech at the summit. 
					
					  If the media are to perform their role as guides and organizers of public opinion, they should discard prejudice and strictly observe objectivity, impartiality and correctness, he said, and continued:
					
					 Only when the media do not resort to prejudice and distortion but conduct impartial and objective press activities from the stand of good faith, can they create an atmosphere of trust and contribute to establishing a fair international information order.
					
					 Any unchallenged news released by the developed media organizations should be trustworthy news objectively reflecting the voices of all national media under any circumstances.
					
					 But the monopoly policy of some multi-national media still in force in the field of media bars the voices of national media from being correctly heard.
					
					 If national media are to creditably perform their role, it is important to boost cooperation among national media and rely on their own information, not on the unreasonable and distorted information released by some multi-national media.
					
					 Though the army and people of the DPRK lost the father of the nation all of a sudden last year, they are making a general march towards a final victory full of conviction under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, he said, adding many reporters of the world must have witnessed this stirring reality during their visit to the DPRK. 
					
					 We are releasing fair and objective reports in the idea of independence, friendship and peace and making positive efforts to boost cooperation and exchange with all media organizations which show good faith towards us.
					
					 He expressed expectation that all the media would correctly see not only the reality of the DPRK but events taking place in the world and release impartial reports about them.

articles.title: Mosaics Depicting Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Erected in Wonsan
articles.content:
Mosaics Depicting Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Erected in Wonsan 
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Mosaics depicting smiling President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il "The great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung will always be with us" and "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il will always be with us" were erected in Wonsan City, Kangwon Province. 
					 This is a manifestation of the firm will of the people in the province to hold Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in high esteem for all ages and eternally glorify the noble revolutionary careers and undying feats of the peerlessly great men. 
					
					 Kim Il Sung visited Kangwon Province dozens of times, clearly indicating the road for the province to follow till the last moments of his life since he set foot on Wonsan in September of 1945. 
					
					 During his great life Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to the province many times, leading overall work in the province with deep care and calling upon the party members and other working people in the province to wage a dynamic drive for building a thriving nation. 
					
					 The unveiling ceremony of the mosaics took place on Sunday.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle for Country's Reunification Supported in Vietnam
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle for Country's Reunification Supported in Vietnam
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- I fully support the Korean people in their struggle for the peaceful reunification of the country. Le Hong Anh, member of the Political Bureau and standing secretary of the Secretariat of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam, said this when meeting the visiting delegation of the C.C., the Democratic Front of the Reunification of Korea headed by Director of its Secretariat Kim Wan Su on Thursday.
					 At the meeting the standing secretary extended warm congratulations to the dear respected Kim Jong Un on his election as first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea at its fourth conference.
					
					 He referred to the Korean people's grand celebrations of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The party and people of Vietnam always remember the full support and encouragement rendered by the WPK and people of the DPRK to Vietnam in its struggle for national liberation and socialist construction, the standing secretary said, expressing belief that the Korean people would achieve greater success, true to the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Korean Resident in Russia Pays Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Korean Resident in Russia Pays Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Jong Il Sim, Korean resident in Russia, and her party visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Sunday, the 18th anniversary of the demise of the President.
					 They laid a floral basket before the statues before paying tribute to them.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung, Guide of Era of Independence in 20th Century
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung, Guide of Era of Independence in 20th Century
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- People of the DPRK and foreigners are visiting the statues of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill in Pyongyang on the anniversary of the demise of Kim Il Sung (July 8). 
					 The President was the guide of the era of independence in the 20th century, recognized by the world.
					
					 He founded the man-centered Juche idea in his teens, showing the way for the popular masses to carve out their own destiny and transform the world.
					
					 The anti-imperialist national liberation struggle that swept many countries in Asia, Africa and Latin America in the 20th century, was launched by the popular masses awakened by the Juche idea.
					
					 The world public praised Kim Il Sung's creation of the Juche idea as a great event and distinguished feat, incomparable to the mythical story that Prometheus brought fire to mankind.
					
					 The President authored "Let Us Accomplish the Cause of Socialism and Communism under the Revolutionary Banner of Juche" and many other works to clarify the essence of global independence and comprehensively show the principles, strategy, tasks and ways for realizing the global independence.
					
					 In his lifetime, he met with party and state leaders, political, public and academic figures and other people of various countries, more than 70,000 in total, and gave answers to questions arising in the cause of global independence.
					
					 The famous flower, Kimilsungia, is cultivated and colorful events held in many countries in praise of the President. The fact shows how deep the world people's yearning for him is.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung, Great Person of Popular Traits
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung, Great Person of Popular Traits
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung, deeply revered by the people the world over, led a humble and simple life in his lifetime.
					 In battles he was a frontline soldier and in creation and construction he was a pacemaker.
					
					 There was a battle in Luozigou in June Juche 23 (1934) during the anti-Japanese armed struggle. To occupy a fort the enemy called impregnable was decisive of victory in the battle.
					
					 At that time, Kim Il Sung rushed towards the fort in the van of the guerrillas to occupy it in less than 30 minutes.
					
					 In March 1958, the President visited a department store in Wonsan City. At the hosiery counter he pointed to a pair of common socks to buy it. As a saleswoman was hesitating, he said he had to wear the same socks as others.
					
					 All things he used in his lifetime, including clothes, food and articles of daily use, were little different from common people's.
					
					 He would personally taste soy and soybean paste to judge their quality and discussed state affairs with ordinary people.
					
					 His personal attraction was based on such popular traits.

articles.title: Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated
articles.content:
Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- The 18th anniversary of the demise of President Kim Il Sung (July 8) has been commemorated in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 On the anniversary, the dear respected Kim Jong Un, together with commanding officers of the Korean People's Army, visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun at 00:00, the greatest memorial day of the nation, to pay tribute to the President.
					
					 The palace was also visited by Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim and other senior party and state officials, the chairperson of a friendly party and officials of party, armed forces and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions.
					
					 People of different social strata went to statues of Kim Il Sung across the country to pay homage to him, recollecting his admirable career and the benevolence shown by him for them.
					
					 In Pyongyang, a large number of people, including servicepersons and schoolchildren, visited the statues of the President and General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill, with floral baskets, bouquets and flowers.
					
					 Seen there was a basket of flowers from Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Many citizens have also visited statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il at the Mansudae Art Studio.
					
					 Of late major newspapers of the country, including Rodong Sinmun, have dedicated much space to articles praising the undying feats of the President, who successfully led the revolution and construction in the DPRK, fully displaying its dignity and honor.

articles.title: Papers Call for Remaining True to Patriotic Cause of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Papers Call for Remaining True to Patriotic Cause of Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Papers Sunday editorially call upon all Koreans to successfully accomplish the patriotic cause of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, single-mindedly united around the dear respected Kim Jong Un and build a thriving nation of Juche on this land. 
					 The noble patriotic intention and will of the President powerfully inspire the army and people of the DPRK in their advance and all the treasures of the Korean-style socialism associated with his whole life as a patriot serve as precious wherewithal for struggle and advance, says Rodong Sinmun. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The 100-year history of Kim Il Sung's nation tells the truth that only when a country holds a peerless patriot and the father of the nation in high esteem, can its dignity and prosperity be guaranteed.
					
					 The human history of politics knows no such father of the nation as the President who successfully led the cause of building the country, the revolution and construction for decades, providing an eternal foundation for the prosperity of the country and the nation. The President is the eternal leader of our party and people who performed immortal patriotic exploits to shine for all ages under the uplifted banner of independence, Songun and socialism. 
					
					 The patriotic cause of the President, who devoted all his life to the country and the people was steadfastly carried forward by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Thanks to the energetic leadership of Kim Jong Il, the Workers' Party of Korea, army and state were developed into the party, army and state of Kim Il Sung, the revolutionary traditions of Mt. Paektu successfully carried forward and a firm foundation of a thriving nation laid. 
					
					 Only when the service personnel and people advance straightly along the road of independence, Songun and socialism indicated by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, can they have an ever-lasting strategy for the Korean revolution and its final victory. Thanks to the experienced leadership of the great party and the army and people who have enshrined loyalty to the leader as their noble moral obligation, the revolutionary cause of Juche started in Mt. Paektu is sure to triumph. 
					
					 Minju Joson calls upon all the officials of the people's power organs and state economic bodies to wage a more dynamic struggle to successfully accomplish the sacred revolutionary cause of Kim Il Sung under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Minju Joson Assails S. Korean Regime's Sycophancy towards Japan
articles.content:
Minju Joson Assails S. Korean Regime's Sycophancy towards Japan 
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- The south Korean "government" authorities' persistent moves to sign the General Security of Military Information Agreement with Japan are little different from what "the five traitors of 1905" did. This is a clear proof that they are steeped in the mentality of selling off the country to Japan to the marrow of their bones.
					 Minju Joson Sunday says this in a bylined commentary. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group of south Korea is working hard to sign the military agreement with the Japan keen to impose even nuclear war disasters upon the Korean nation, openly calling for nuclear weaponization. This cannot be construed otherwise than an extremely dangerous action to hide the crimes committed by Japan against the Korean nation in the past and pave the way for the Japanese reactionaries' reinvasion. 
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that the Lee group's moves to sign the military agreement are aiming at doing harm to fellow countrymen in collusion with outside forces. It is as clear as daylight that in case the south Korean authorities conclude the military agreement with Japan, this will mean the completion of the "tri-angular military alliance" involving the U.S., Japan and south Korea. 
					
					 Through the alliance the U.S. seeks to invade the DPRK and, furthermore, maintain an unchallenged position in Northeast Asia. And on the strength of the alliance the Japanese reactionaries aim to realize their ambition for staging a comeback to Korea in collusion with south Korea, backed by the U.S. The Lee group of traitors seeks to use the alliance as a lever for doing harm to fellow countrymen under the patronage of outside forces. Owing to the Lee group's sycophancy towards Japan, the situation on the Korean Peninsula has reached the brink of war and the peace and stability in the region are facing a grave challenge. 
					
					 All facts go to prove that the Lee group is a band of pro-U.S. and pro-Japanese lackeys who stoop to any infamy to hurt compatriots. 
					
					 The Korean nation will never be safe as long as this group is allowed to be at large.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Applies for Warrant of Arrest of Ro Su Hui
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Applies for Warrant of Arrest of Ro Su Hui
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities applied for the warrant of arrest of Ro Su Hui, vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon), on charge of violation of the "Security Law", south Korean KBS reported on July 6.
					 A joint investigation group comprising agents of prosecution, police and the Intelligence Service detained Ro at Phaju Police Station in Kyonggi Province and is investigating how he paid the condolence visit to Pyongyang, as well as his activities in the north.
					
					 It was reported that Ro is protesting against the security authorities' suppression, with his mouth shut.
					
					 Infuriated by this, fascists are planning to put in custody on charges of "infiltration and escape" and "praise and encouragement".
					
					 Meanwhile, the security authorities applied for the warrant of arrest of the secretary general of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon on the same charges by linking him with the condolence visit of Ro.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Suppression of Pro-reunification Champion Blasted
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Suppression of Pro-reunification Champion Blasted
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- As soon as  Ro Su Hui, vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon), crossed the demarcation line in Panmunjom on July 5, south Korean gangsters hurled by the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors pounced upon him and dragged him like an animal. They took Ro to Phaju Police Station in Kyonggi Province and are questioning him.
					 Minju Joson Sunday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 These reckless acts of the Lee group amount to outrageous hysteria to escalate confrontation with fellow countrymen as they are a blatant challenge to the desire and wish of the Koreans for national reconciliation, unity and reunification.
					
					 The group of traitors is harshly cracking down on the pro-reunification patriot though it is under fire by Koreans for its indelible crimes against the country and the nation, the commentary notes, adding: 
					
					 This is the most horrible barbarism.
					
					 The group's crackdown on Ro is unprecedented cruel action. Not a few pro-reunification patriotic figures have so far visited Pyongyang and gone back to south Korea via Panmunjom. But it is the first time that such unspeakable brutality was committed without hesitation in the eyes of the world. This indicates the height of confrontation hysteria of the Lee group bereft of reason, to say nothing of justice, conscience, morality and ethics.
					
					 What merits a serious attention is that the group perpetrated again such hideous provocation as hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					
					 The Lee group will have to experience what dear price it will have to pay for the above-said crimes.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservative Media Accused of Distorting Fact
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservative Media Accused of Distorting Fact
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Conservative media of south Korea are distorting the fact about Ro Su Hui, vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon), who was arrested by south Korean hooligans after visiting Pyongyang.
					 In this regard, Ri Pok Sun, department director of the C.C., Journalists Union of Korea, told KCNA:
					
					 The south Korean conservative media are now hell-bent on heaping abuses on the vice-chairman, who was taken away like a package to a police station before getting reunion with his wife and children.
					
					 The ultra-right conservative media, including Chosun Ilbo, Dong-A Ilbo and Daily NK, linked Ro's Pyongyang visit with "praise" of the DPRK and "accusation" against the Lee Myung Bak regime, while keeping mum about the cruel assaults the hooligans inflicted upon him. On July 6 a day after Ro's arrest, Chosun Ilbo carried an article titled "Why Is Pomminryon Left Intact?"
					
					 They have insulted even the dignity of the DPRK supreme leadership and slandered its fair reunification policy, siding with the political gangsters hostile to the reunification champions in the south.
					
					 In fact, they are paid servants of power and present-day Nazi media.
					
					In contrary to their outcry over "human rights" and "freedom of thinking", they agitate for the suppression of reunification champions in south Korea, criticizing their patriotic action as "sympathy with the north".
					
					 Miserable end is awaiting the conservative, treacherous media seeking confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north.

articles.title: Staff Members of Chinese, Russian Consulates-general Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Staff Members of Chinese, Russian Consulates-general Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Staff members of the Chinese Consulate-general in Chongjin visited the statue of President Kim Il Sung in Phohang District of Chongjin City, North Hamgyong Province on Sunday to pay tribute to him on the 18th anniversary of his demise.
					 They laid a floral basket before the statue and made a bow to him.
					
					 Earlier, staff members of the Russian Consulate-general in Chongjin visited the statue of the President in Ranam District of the city to pay homage to him.
					
					 On the same day various Chinese delegations staying in the city placed bouquets before his statue.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Carried by Namibian Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Carried by Namibian Paper
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- The gist of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "On Effecting a Drastic Turn in Land Management to Meet the Requirements for Building a Thriving Socialist Nation" was carried by the Namibian paper New Era on June 18.
					 The work, published on April 27, 2012, clarifies the undying exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il in land management and indicates the general orientation and tasks for face-lifting the country's land as befitting a thriving socialist nation.

articles.title: Venezuelan Group for Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism Formed
articles.content:
Venezuelan Group for Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism Formed
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- The Venezuelan Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism was formed on June 29.
					 Present at the inaugural ceremony were Omar Lopez, chairman of the Venezuelan National Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, Diego Antonio Rivero, chairman of the Venezuela-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association, and academic personages.
					
					 Dr. Garcia was elected chief of the group.
					
					 A letter to the dear respected Kim Jong Un was adopted at the ceremony.

articles.title: Seminars on Kim Il Sung's Feats Held in Different Countries
articles.content:
Seminars on Kim Il Sung's Feats Held in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Seminars on the feats of President Kim Il Sung were held in Nepal, Bangladesh and Egypt on July 2 on the occasion of the 18th anniversary of his demise.
					 Displayed in their venues were photos showing the undying revolutionary feats of Kim Il Sung and the late General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 C. P. Mainali, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist), said the whole life of the President was the undying life dedicated to the liberation of the country and its people's happiness and national reunification. 
					
					 The President was the great people's leader who founded the Juche idea centered on man in his early years, pursued the policy for the people and waged revolutionary struggles in reliance on them, the general secretary noted.
					
					 M. Jahangir Khan, chairman of the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy, and other speakers praised the President as the distinguished leader who built the most powerful fortress of independence in the world and greatly contributed to the cause of global independence.
					
					 Yehia Zakaria Khairullah, chairman of the Egyptian Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, referred to the revolutionary family of the President.
					
					 He explained the undying feats the President performed by wisely leading along the straight road of victory the Korean revolution including the anti-Japanese armed struggle, the building of new Korea, the Fatherland Liberation War and socialist construction.
					
					 A message to the dear respected Kim Jong Un was adopted at the seminar held in Nepal.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Papers of Bangladesh, Indonesia
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Papers of Bangladesh, Indonesia
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Papers of Bangladesh and Indonesia carried articles praising the undying feats of President Kim Il Sung on the occasion of the 18th anniversary of his demise.
					 The Bangladeshi paper Natun Bangla on July 1 carried an article titled "People's leader". 
					
					 18 years have passed since the President passed away, but the Korean people are holding him in high esteem as the eternal leader, the article said, adding:
					
					 Regarding it as his maxim to believe in people as in Heaven, he turned the DPRK into a tax-free country and a country where free healthcare and free compulsory educational system are in force. The feats he performed by building a genuine socialist system centered on the popular masses in the DPRK will shine forever.
					
					 The Indonesian paper Suara Karya on June 29 carried an article titled "August name of President Kim Il Sung is shining as the sun".     
					
					 It noted:
					
					 The august name of the President, the founder of socialist Korea, means the sun. His august name always shines like the sun. It is shining as a symbol of national liberation and the era of independence.
					
					 The paper introduced in detail the fact that he wisely led the struggle against domination and subjugation worldwide and the struggle for the independence of the country, nation and popular masses. 
					
					 His august name is also shining as a symbol of noble virtues, sense of obligation and banner of eternal victory.

articles.title: U.S. Can Never Evade Responsibility as Provocateur of Korean War: Brazilian Paper
articles.content:
U.S. Can Never Evade Responsibility as Provocateur of Korean War: Brazilian Paper
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian paper Hora do Povo on June 29 carried an article titled "U.S. can never evade the responsibility for igniting war against DPRK" on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 The balance of forces in the light of the international political situation and international relations at the time when the Korean War broke out was very unfavorable for the U.S. strategy for world domination, the paper said, and went on:
					
					 When an arms race unprecedented in the U.S. history started and horror of economic crisis reached the height, the U.S. authorities decided to launch the Korean War as a way for tiding over it.
					
					 In those days the British magazine Economist said that the U.S. needed an opportunity to tide over the crisis. It had no alternative but to start a war.
					
					 The U.S. ignited the Korean War as it was upset by the daily growing political, military and economic potentials of the northern half of Korea.
					
					 The paper introduced in detail articles and photos of foreign media including the Swiss paper Neue Zurcher Zeitung and AP proving that the U.S. ignited the Korean War. It continued:
					
					 The U.S. can never evade the responsibility for igniting the Korean War. The DPRK called for replacing the Armistice Agreement with a peace one in order to ensure lasting peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 But the truce is continuing due to the interests of the U.S. which does not want peace on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un visita el Palacio del Sol
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un visita el Palacio del Sol
Pyongyang, 8 de julio (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, junto con los miembros directivos del EPC, visito a la 00:00 del dia 8, dia nacional de recordacion, el Palacio del Sol de Kumsusan, donde rindio sublime homenaje postumo al Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					Estuvo en el hall donde se encuentran las estatuas de pie del Presidente y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Fue depositado ante las estatuas un cesto de flores en nombre del Comandante Supremo del EPC.
					
					Tambien, se coloco el otro en nombre del Ministerio de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares.
					
					En la cinta del cesto se ven las letras "!El gran camarada Kim Il Sung y el camarada Kim Jong Il viven siempre en nosotros!"
					
					El Maximo Dirigente junto con los miembros directivos del EPC expreso sublime homenaje ante las estatuas.
					
					Entro en el hall donde conserva el cuerpo del Presidente y le rindio el mas sublime tributo.
					
					Luego, Kim Jong Un recorrio la sala de conservacion de ordenes del Presidente, el vagon y el carro que usaba el Presidente en el ultimo periodo de su vida.
					
					En el hall donde se hallan los retratos del Presidente y el Dirigente con amplia sonrisa, el y otros acompanantes rindieron homenaje ante los retratos.
					
					Le acompanaron Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Jong Gak, Hyon Chol Hae, Choe Pu Il, Son Chol Ju, Pak Jae Gyong, Jo Kyong Chol, Kim Yong Chol, Ri Pyong Chol y otros miembros directivos del EPC.
